title: The Bachelorette: Angie Kent horrified as a suitor storms out of the mansion
text:
The Bachelorette's first cocktail party could end in tears, with a new trailer showing contestant Ciarran Stott storming out in a fit of rage.

In a promotional clip released on Monday, the 25-year-old Englishman snaps during a confrontation with the other men before walking off set.

'I'm done with this show... get me out of here!' Ciarran says, as camera operators scramble to follow him as he makes a quick exit.

'I'm done with this... get me out of here!' The Bachelorette 's first cocktail party could end in tears, with a new trailer showing contestant Ciarran Stott storming out in a fit of rage

While it's unclear when the incident occurs - or whether producers convinced Ciarran to return to the set - it's possible the walkout took place on the first night.

In the dramatic footage, Ciarran is shown clashing with co-star Timm Hanly before storming out and branding him a 'f**king idiot'.

He removes his blazer as he leaves the mansion, with the other men watching on in disbelief.

What's going on? Producers were seemingly unprepared for Ciarran's departure, as the trailer showed them desperately trying to set up cameras to capture Angie's response

Drama! While it's unclear when the incident occurs - or whether producers convinced Ciarran to return to the set - it's possible the walkout took place on the very first night

The trailer then cut to Angie's shocked reaction.

Producers were seemingly unprepared for Ciarran's departure, as the trailer showed them desperately trying to set up cameras to capture Angie's response.

She was sharing an intimate moment with contestant Carlin Sterritt at the time of Ciarran's exit, but it's unclear if this is what sparked his anger.

Secret's out! On Thursday, Daily Mail Australia revealed that Ciarran may have another reason for being on the show besides simply finding love

On Thursday, Daily Mail Australia revealed that Ciarran may have another reason for being on the show besides simply finding love.

A source claimed that he applied for the show because his ex-girlfriend Renee Barrett appeared on Matt Agnew's season of The Bachelor.

'As soon as he found out she'd been cast on Matt's season and was about to start filming, he decided to get on The Bachelorette,' said the insider.

'Casting producers were aware of this and it definitely helped his cause. His friends are saying he mostly went on to get back at Renee.'
